link.synopsis: One hails from a New Zealand sheep farm, while the other calls London's Chelsea district home. But thanks to a lothario dad, they're sisters -- a fact unknown to the Chelsea girl until she finds her uncouth Kiwi half-sib drinking a beer on her sofa. The next surprise? That dad, long presumed dead, is alive and kicking -- and trying to swindle both of his daughters out of their property in this comedy written by and starring Emily Corcoran.
link.title: synopsis
The Englishman Who Went Up a Hill but Came Down a Mountain
The Young, the Gay and the Restless

link.synopsis: Divorced, disenchanted and disinclined to do anything besides smoke dope and watch TV, Achilles (Will Beinbrink) finds his desultory existence turned upside down when he receives an odd inheritance -- a camping trailer decked out as a watermelon. Despite reservations, Achilles accepts the "gift," and soon the parked behemoth is attracting all kinds of oddballs -- including the young runaway Achilles finds sleeping there in this romantic comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Luke and Brie Are on a First Date
Tyler Perry's Madea Goes to Jail

link.synopsis: Big secrets beget comedy in this production of director-playwright Lenore Faith's gospel stage play about a married couple (Shawn Smith and Mahalia Jackson), their mutual friend, Skeeter (Don "D.C." Curry), and members of the nearby Living Stone Community Church. Thanks to Skeeter's bustling barber shop business, he's got a grasp on the local gossip, which means he's got plenty of tales to tell about the neighbors.
link.title: synopsis
There's a Stranger in My House
The Blood of Jesus / Lying Lips
WWE: Jeff Hardy: My Life, My Rules
Tyler Perry's Madea's Big Happy Family: The Play
Soviet Army Chorus, Band and Dance Ensemble
Blue Man Group: How to Be a Megastar Live!
ARTS: A Film About Possibilities, Disabilities & the Arts
Visual Acoustics: The Modernism of Julius Shulman
Tyler Perry: What's Done in the Dark
I'm Doing the Right Thing with the Wrong Man
A Prairie Home Collection: Great Moments from the Original Radio Show
Rant: Who Says Words with My Mouth
A Prairie Home Companion with Garrison Keillor

title.regular: You Don't Tell I Won't Tell
title.short: You Don't Tell I Won't Tell

link.synopsis: In this version of a live gospel stage play, bride-to-be Tracie (Nei-Ce Knight-Preuitt) is ready to take the wedding plunge, but a surprise mishap causes an issue from her past to rear its ugly head. Now, she's not sure whom to turn to for advice in this romantic comedy. Usually, straight-talking, Bible-thumping Aunt Shirley (Bridgette Bentley) can be counted on for sound counsel, but her own past may be clouding her judgment now.
link.title: synopsis
There's a Stranger in My House
Tyler Perry's I Can Do Bad All by Myself
I'm Doing the Right Thing with the Wrong Man
Don't Touch If You Ain't Prayed
Willie Banks and the Messengers in Concert
My Favorite Broadway: The Leading Ladies
The Flaming Lips: Christmas On Mars
The Boys and Girl from County Clare
Seven Brides for Seven Brothers: 50th Anniversary Edition
With a Song in My Heart

title.regular: Love Ain't Suppose to Hurt 2: The Wedding
title.short: Love Ain't Suppose to Hurt 2: The Wedding

link.synopsis: With his parents out of town for the weekend, Dewayne (Justin Aaron Daniels) agrees to his best friend's plan for throwing a party their friends will never forget. But with his grandma all up in his business, Dewayne might never get the party off the ground. The neighbors are nosier than usual, too … and then there's the issue of his meddling school principal. Khyle Armoure co-stars in this urban comedy from director Marcello Thedford.
link.title: synopsis
I Got Five on It Too
Kirk Whalum: The Gospel According to Jazz: Chapter 2
Roger Waters: In the Flesh: Live
My Big Phat Hip Hop Family
House Party 4: Down to the Last Minute

link.synopsis: Player Richard Jones (Kel Mitchell) meets his match when one of the (many) women he's cast off puts a curse on him that leaves him minus his manhood. Now, our diminished hero is in a race against time to determine which wronged gal is responsible. A voodoo priestess tries to help, but Jones is going to have to do a lot of apologizing if he's to correct the hex before it becomes permanent in this comedy inked and helmed by Dwayne Alexander Smith.
link.title: synopsis
The Sex Adventures of the Three Musketeers
Shaquille O'Neal Presents: All Star Comedy Jam: Live from South Beach
Shaq & Cedric the Entertainer Present: All Star Comedy Jam
I Got Five on It Too
The Mostly Unfabulous Social Life of Ethan Green
Trailer Park Boys: Countdown to Liquor Day
National Lampoon's Ratko: The Dictator's Son
Harold & Kumar Escape from Guantanamo Bay
The 41-Year-Old Virgin Who Knocked Up Sarah Marshall and Felt Superbad About It

link.synopsis: Friends all give loveable and idiosyncratic Harris Malden (Nick Gregorio) special treatment. No one wants to tell him that his large, black drawn-on moustache isn't real. So they go along with the illusion -- until his friend's (Eric M. Levy) date blurts the obvious. Now they must deal with the consequences of Harris's breakdown. Brigitte Hagerman stars as Paul's girlfriend, Susan, in this quirky comedy about unconditional love and acceptance.
link.title: synopsis
The Immaculate Conception of Little Dizzle
He Died with a Felafel in His Hand
Me and You and Everyone We Know
Mike Birbiglia: What I Should Have Said Was Nothing: Tales From My Secret Public Journal
A Film with Me in It

link.synopsis: In this romantic comedy, 27-year-old aspiring screenwriter Ah-mi (Min-hie Kim), her 40-year-old sister, Yeong-mi (Mi-suk Lee), and teenage niece, Kang-ae (So-hee Ahn), weather the ups and downs of life and love in modern-day Korea. Yeong-mi faces menopause as she begins a romance with a younger man; Ah-mi must decide between her rocker boyfriend and a boring yet successful accountant; and Kang-ae is confused by her feelings for her best friend.
link.title: synopsis
I Really, Really Like You: Vol. 2
The Virgin Stripped Bare by Her Bachelors
Tae Guk Gi: The Brotherhood of War

link.synopsis: When unlucky delinquents Sachin (Kunal Khemu) and Zaramud (Cyrus Broacha) attempt to collect a debt for their boss, they stumble into a series of random misadventures involving a beautiful woman, treacherous criminals, incredible conspiracies and a large sum of money. Directed by Raj Nidimoru and Krishna D.K., this Bollywood comedy also stars Boman Irani, Soha Ali Khan, Simone Singh and Mahesh Manjrekar.
link.title: synopsis
Rocket Singh: Salesman of the Year

link.synopsis: After receiving a surprise promotion, Ken (David Cross) humiliates his jokester colleagues Rodney (Michael Vartan) and Mike (Sean Astin) by demoting them to the secretarial pool. To keep their jobs, the two chauvinists must finally learn how to respect women and accept responsibility. James B. Rogers directs this prank-filled comedy that also stars Sara Foster, Erin Cahill, Constance Zimmer and Billy West.
link.title: synopsis
Tyler Perry's Madea Goes to Jail
Luke and Brie Are on a First Date

link.synopsis: Five-time Oscar nominee Irene Dunne headlines this screwball comedy double bill alongside a cast of Hollywood heavyweights, including Melvyn Douglas and frequent collaborator Charles Boyer. In the first film, Dunne stars as a prim schoolteacher who writes a steamy novel that sends shockwaves through her small town. In the second, Dunne plays a widow who falls for an eccentric artist (Boyer) hired to fashion a statue of her late husband.
link.title: synopsis
My Sister Eileen / She Wouldn't Say Yes
I Met Him in Paris / Bluebeard's Eighth Wife
If You Could Only Cook / Too Many Husbands
The Doctor Takes a Wife / A Night to Remember
Irene Dunne Romance Classics: Love Affair / Penny Serenade
Anna and the King of Siam
Beat the Devil / That Uncertain Feeling

link.synopsis: Plotting to make some quick cash, conniving young Monya (Bharat Jadhav) targets the residents of a village caught in a feud with a neighboring community, but his plans are jeopardized when another youth who closely resembles him also arrives in town. As each boy is repeatedly mistaken for the other, they both must contend with the two villages' feverish rivalry over which will host a religious festival. Kedar Shinde directs this comedy.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: The sketch comedy gang Howard Stern calls "very, very funny" returns with more of their politically incorrect humor in this compilation that includes dozens of skits, cartoons, impersonations and much more. Foulmouthed Yucko the Clown wanders the streets insulting unsuspecting pedestrians and homeless Jimmy Gibberish sings his own version of  "The Star-Spangled Banner." Other characters include Regina Lynn, Bobby Possumcods and Rack Em Willie.
link.title: synopsis
Yucko the Clown: The Damn Show
UFC: The Ultimate 100 Greatest Fights: Vol. 4
New York Mets: Essential Games of Shea Stadium
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Cheri Oteri
Saturday Night Live: Live from New York: The First 5 Years
The Carol Burnett Show: Show Stoppers
The House of Venus Show: Season 2
SCTV: Best of the Early Years
Abbott and Costello Funniest Routines: Vol. 1
Abbott and Costello Funniest Routines: Vol. 2
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Gilda Radner
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Jon Lovitz
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Amy Poehler
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Will Ferrell: Vol. 3
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Tom Hanks
The Carol Burnett Show: Let's Bump Up the Lights!
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Steve Martin
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Phil Hartman
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Commercial Parodies
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Jimmy Fallon
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Dan Aykroyd
Saturday Night Live: The Best of John Belushi
The Second City: The First Family of Comedy
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Dana Carvey
The Kibbles and Bits of Hellorama
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Eddie Murphy
The Daily Show with Jon Stewart: Indecision 2004
John Ritter Comedy Special: Being of Sound Mind & Body
The Best of Triumph the Insult Comic Dog
Late Night with Conan O'Brien 10th Anniversary Special
The League of Gentlemen: Christmas Special
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Mike Myers
The Best of So Graham Norton
Studio 60 on the Sunset Strip: The Complete Series
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Chris Rock
The House of Venus Show: Season 1
Nardwuar: The Human Serviette: Welcome to My Castle
The Best of the Colbert Report
Saturday Night Live: Lost & Found: SNL in the 80's
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Saturday TV Funhouse
Comedy Central Salutes George W. Bush
Peter Cook & Dudley Moore: The Best of... What's Left of... Not Only... But Also...
Saturday Night Live: The Best of '06/'07
Knowing Me Knowing You with Alan Partridge: The Complete Series

link.synopsis: Desperate to save her late father's failing movie theater, nerdy librarian Deborah Tennis (Natasha Lyonne) debuts a series of gruesome short films, each gorier than the one before. The audience eats them up, unaware that they document Deborah's own murder spree. Midnight movie icon Joshua Grannell (aka drag star Peaches Christ) makes his writing and directing debut with this grisly comedy. Thomas Dekker and Cassandra "Elvira" Peterson co-star.
link.title: synopsis
The Immaculate Conception of Little Dizzle
Zombies / The Blood Seekers / Blood Stalkers
The Curse of the Black Dahlia

link.synopsis: The aroma of pizza revives dying mob leader Don Vito Perspirino (Vincent Pastore), who then gloms onto pizza maker Johnny (Ronnie Marmo) as his long-lost son. This is good news for Johnny, whose gambling debts are forgiven; bad news for those waiting for the don to depart. Both men end up on the hit list in this comedy that satirizes the best in gangster stories. Talia Shire, Tony Devon and Tony Longo co-star.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: In this unusual hybrid comedy by filmmaker Alex Karpovsky, a tiny Arkansas town becomes the center of the universe for diehard bird-watchers committed to sighting the elusive ivory-billed woodpecker. Jon Hyrns and Wesley Yang set off to distinguish themselves among the many bird-watchers who have committed themselves to this sometimes trying but surprisingly gratifying pursuit.  Will they soar to success or fall to the Earth with a thud?
link.title: synopsis
So Many Feathers: Bird Watching Without Binoculars
Trust Us, This Is All Made Up
Client 9: The Rise and Fall of Eliot Spitzer
Beach Blanket Bingo / How to Stuff a Wild Bikini
Weird Tale Collection: Vol. 1: The Yellow Sign and Others
National Geographic: Guns, Germs and Steel
It's Kind of a Funny Story
Luke and Brie Are on a First Date
Tyler Perry's Madea Goes to Jail

link.synopsis: When the happy family life she worked so hard to build crumbles around her, Elestra Henton (Vanessa Bell Calloway) returns to the stage to revive her long-abandoned dreams of becoming a professional stand-up comedian. But when her self-centered former manager comes back into the picture, Miss E must confront a slew of old secrets that come to light. This inspiring comedy from director Michael Whaley co-stars Roger Guenveur Smith.
link.title: synopsis
There's a Stranger in My House
Bring It On: Fight to the Finish
Tyler Perry's I Can Do Bad All by Myself
Soul Theater Series: The Fabric of a Man
Bloody Mama / A Bucket of Blood
Shaq & Cedric the Entertainer Present: All Star Comedy Jam
A Love Song for Bobby Long
I Think I Love My Wife
Precious: Based on the Novel Push by Sapphire

link.synopsis: High schooler Stan's crippling fear of germs and his best friend Ben's anxiety-induced fainting spells hamper their efforts with girls, not to mention their earnest attempts to share their Jehovah's Witness faith by knocking on neighborhood doors. But when an elderly woman dies during their visit, their phobias go berserk and threaten their very friendship. Aaron Wocher and Kiel D. Adams star in this comedy from director Grant Emmerson.
link.title: synopsis
Luke and Brie Are on a First Date
Tyler Perry's Madea Goes to Jail
Glow Ropes: The Rise and Fall of a Bar Mitzvah Emcee
Dave Barry's Complete Guide to Guys
Donald and Dot Clock Found Dead in Their Home

link.synopsis: Chris Kattan (starring as himself) leaves Hollywood behind when he lands the leading role in the Bollywood film Peculiar Dancing Boy. But when Bollywood proves to be no easy song and dance, burned bridges leave him stranded in a sea of hilarious culture clashes. Fired after his first day, Kattan faces a kissing scandal and more as he launches a desperate campaign for Bollywood stardom. Julian Sands and Neha Dhupia co-star in this comedy miniseries.
link.title: synopsis
Rocket Singh: Salesman of the Year
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Chris Kattan
Brian Regan: The Epitome of Hyperbole
Tristram Shandy: A Cock and Bull Story

link.synopsis: Uptight desk jockey Kent (Chris Gibbs) loses his cool when newly hired Adam (Peter Mooney) -- a handsome, affable and brilliant android -- starts outperforming him. To protect his comfy life, Kent foolishly tries to ruin his robotic rival by any means necessary. This quirky comedy set in the near future also features Lara Kelly as cute co-worker Allison and Christian Potenza as the hero's screwy pal, Garth.
link.title: synopsis
Our Hitler: A Film from Germany
The Immaculate Conception of Little Dizzle
Futurama: Into the Wild Green Yonder

link.synopsis: Follow the antics of outspoken ice-skating talent Johnny Weir -- who provided a loose inspiration for Jon Heder's character in the comedy hit Blades of Glory -- as he balances dreams of Olympic victory with his triple-axel personality. This gripping and funny documentary examines Weir's brutal training sessions in small-town Delaware, his unique relationship with his longtime coach, Priscilla Hill, and his unconventional public behavior.
link.title: synopsis
30 for 30: The Legend Of Jimmy the Greek
30 for 30: No Crossover: The Trial of Allen Iverson
Magic & Bird: A Courtship of Rivals
Troy's Story: The Legend of Superbike Champion Troy Bayliss
David Beckham: Life of an Icon
Billy Martin: The Man, the Myth, the Manager
The Wheelie King: The Doug Domokos Story
Hello Again Everybody: The Harry Caray Story
Rising Son: The Legend of Skateboarder Christian Hosoi
The American Dream: The Dusty Rhodes Story
Muhammad Ali: Through the Eyes of the World
Unforgivable Blackness: The Rise and Fall of Jack Johnson
Ring of Fire: The Emile Griffith Story

link.synopsis: Years after his teammates' bullying antics left him in the hospital, a cricketer returns to his Australian homeland to play again. Only this time, the game is vengeance, and he has the razor-fingered cricket gloves and nail-covered balls to prove it! As the death count rises, Scotland Yard sleuth Kim Reynolds (Stacey Edmonds) arrives in Sydney to assist local detectives Chance (Jai Koutrae) and Scott (Az Jackson) in this offbeat horror comedy.
link.title: synopsis
It's My Party and I'll Die if I Want To
American Pie Presents: The Book of Love
The Texas Chainsaw Massacre: The Beginning

title.regular: I Know How Many Runs You Scored Last Summer
title.short: I Know How Many Runs You Scored...

link.synopsis: Irish slackers Myles (Ardal O'Hanlon) and Austin (Ewen Bremner) figure out how to pay off a debt when a disreputable entrepreneur hires them to build a tourist theme park celebrating the Great Famine in this charming comedy from Ireland. Now the pseudo-intellectual Myles and hyperactive dim bulb Austin find themselves facing unexpected challenges that strain their friendship and test their ethical boundaries.
link.title: synopsis
Extreme Animation: Films by Phil Mulloy
Straight Men and the Men Who Love Them

link.synopsis: In this mockumentary comedy, rocker-turned-roadie Le Donk (Paddy Considine) hits the highway touring with British band Arctic Monkeys. Hoping to jumpstart the career of Nottingham rapper Scorzayzee (himself), Donk takes his hip-hop prodigy along for the ride. Filmmaker Shane Meadows captures five days in Donk's adventure, including his attempted reunion with his ex-girlfriend (Olivia Colman), despite her pregnancy with her current boyfriend.
link.title: synopsis
Tristram Shandy: A Cock and Bull Story
Once Upon a Time in the Midlands
Love and Death on Long Island
Neil Gaiman's A Short Film About John Bolton

link.synopsis: Unable to afford college, Melissa Brooks (Christine Evangelista) moves in with her oddball older brother in New York and lands a job waiting tables at a comedy club. After watching the veteran comics perform, Melissa is inspired to develop her own act. Despite encouragement from her coworkers, she finds that writing jokes is easier than going on stage. And just to make life interesting, she also lands at the center of a complicated love triangle.
link.title: synopsis
Once Upon a Time in the Midlands

link.synopsis: Three grownup siblings -- all in their 30s -- let their collective self-absorption trump any chance of true happiness in this fly-on-the-wall comedy from first-time director (and psychiatrist) Avie Luthra. With a narrative that shifts among the trio -- Atul (Nitin Ganatra), Hardeep (Zubin Varla) and Rashmi (Meera Syal) -- the film chronicles the messes they make navigating the waters of love and relationships through the prisms of their neuroses.
link.title: synopsis
Extreme Animation: Films by Phil Mulloy
Straight Men and the Men Who Love Them

link.synopsis: An eternal optimist and assistant steakhouse manager, Harold (Gordon Michaels) follows all of his dreams with gusto. After helping the beautiful Wanda (Nicole DeHuff) land a job at his restaurant, he focuses his attention on winning her affection. But things don't look good for Harold when Wanda's rocker ex-boyfriend (Dylan McDermott) enters the picture. Set in Reno, Nev., this quirky comedy co-stars Henry Winkler and Phyllis Diller.
link.title: synopsis
Did You Hear About the Morgans?
Full Bottom: Not Another Half-Arsed Release
Bridget Jones: The Edge of Reason
How to Lose Friends & Alienate People
Miss Pettigrew Lives for a Day

link.synopsis: While staying at her mother's (Dominique Valadie) place, eccentric author Célimène (Chiara Mastroianni) wages a losing battle against writer's block, struggles to get her life back on track and forms an unexpected bond with an overeager teenage girl (Agathe Bonitzer) who wants to be in her next book. Written and directed by Sophie Fillières, this quirky French comedy co-stars Mateo Julio Cedron as Célimène's young son.
link.title: synopsis
I Do: How to Get Married and Stay Single

link.synopsis: Staring down a severe midlife crisis, gay tractor salesman Armand (Ludovic Berthillot) tries to "turn straight" by pursuing a cute 16-year-old girl (Hafsia Herzi) who fancies him, but harsh disapproval from her parents and the cops forces the mismatched pair to go on the run. Written and directed by Alain Guiraudie, this delightfully offbeat French comedy co-stars Pascal Aubert, Luc Palun and François Clavier.
link.title: synopsis
In the Arms of My Enemy
Otto; or, Up With Dead People

link.synopsis: Hervé (Vincent Lacoste), a shy high schooler who spends all his time obsessing about girls, can't believe it when attractive classmate Aurore (Alice Trémolière) develops a crush on him. But trying to score with this cutie leads the sex-crazed teen to suffer endless humiliation. Full of outrageous gags and gross-out humor, this triumphant teen comedy co-stars Noemie Lvovsky as Hervé's nosy mother and Anthony Sonigo as his best friend.
link.title: synopsis
The Diving Bell and the Butterfly
Henri Langlois: Phantom of the Cinematheque
The Beat That My Heart Skipped
How Much Do You Love Me?

link.synopsis: A radical reinvention of Shakespeare's classic play, this horror movie follows lovely Juliet (Hannah Kauffmann) and flesh-eating zombie Romeo (Jason Witter) as they begin a truly bizarre romance that sparks a bloody war between their rival clans -- the living and the undead. Mixing romantic comedy moments with graphic violence, Ryan Denmark's directorial debut also stars Mark Chavez, Kate Schroeder and Reuben Finkelstein.
link.title: synopsis
Otto; or, Up With Dead People
Return of the Living Dead 4: Necropolis

title.regular: Romeo & Juliet vs. the Living Dead
title.short: Romeo & Juliet vs. the Living Dead

link.synopsis: Petty drug pusher Nesio (Jorge Adrián Espíndola) finds his life spiraling out of control when he's unjustly implicated in a high-profile homicide. And things get even weirder when he meets a mysterious masked woman who seems to know him better than he knows himself. Set in Mexico City, this acerbic black comedy from writer-director Alan Coton also stars Claudette Maillé, Tenoch Huerta and César Jaime.
link.title: synopsis
Donde Quedo La Abuela? El Viaje De La Nonna

link.synopsis: Mushtaq Pasha directs this outrageous comedy that follows the fortunes of three sets of twins who encounter one misadventure after another, including plots involving mistaken identities, long-lost siblings, political subterfuge and thwarted love. As one pair dupes another in a scheme for wealth, they must contend with the police and a romance involving the third pair of twins. Kulbhusan Kharbanda, Rana Jung Bahadur and Rakesh Bedi star.
link.title: synopsis
Kal Ho Naa Ho: Tomorrow May Never Come

link.synopsis: When poor orphans Munna (Masti Ali) and Pappu (Aziz Nasar) fall in love with sisters Reshma (Vandana) and Nazma (Stuti Misra), the girls' father rejects the lads and betroths his daughters instead to two young suitors he believes are globe-trotting gentlemen. Undeterred, Munna and Pappu turn to a local gang leader to help expose their rivals for what they are: crooks and ex-cons. Lakshmikanth Chenna directs this lighthearted romantic comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Rocket Singh: Salesman of the Year
Hum Aapke Dil Mein Rehte Hain

link.synopsis: Weary of being constantly taunted for his lack of courage, a young villager (Bharat Jadhav) accepts his mother's help in landing a job caring for the town's haunted cemetery, where he can prove his bravery once and for all. But no sooner does he take the position than a trio of the graveyard's ghostly spooks pays him a frightful visit. Pitambar Kale directs this comedy that co-stars Nisha Parulekar, Ramesh Bhatkar and Madhu Kambikar.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: Timely and irreverent, this comedy series follows Amjad (Norman Issa), a Palestinian reporter whose work and Israeli citizenship have turned his life into one big identity crisis. Each episode finds the irony and hilarity in Amjad's fish-out-of-water existence. The premiere season finds Amjad learning he owns the "wrong car," interviewing a sheep and, with his wife, racing another couple to have the first baby born on Independence Day.
link.title: synopsis
Homicide: Life on the Street: Seasons 1 & 2
Dead Kennedys: In God We Trust, Inc.
Return from India: A Story of Forbidden Love

link.synopsis: When small-time crook Bob (Gérard Depardieu) insinuates himself into the bourgeois lives of lovely Monique (Miou-Miou) and her henpecked husband, Antoine (Michel Blanc), he seduces them with the excitement of experimental sex and petty burglary. But as the balance of power shifts in their new ménage à trios, the couple discovers there's no going back to their stale but stable status quo. Bertrand Blier directs this brilliantly twisted comedy.
link.title: synopsis
How Much Do You Love Me?
François Ozon: A Curtain Raiser & Other Shorts
The Other Side of the Bed

link.synopsis: Feeling at loose ends, lonely and restless retiree Walter (Carlo Delle Piane) sets out to reengage his life by helping painfully awkward clerk Piero (Pierfrancesco Favino) court a beautiful woman he's been too bashful to ask out. But as the elderly do-gooder eggs the younger man on, his encouragement threatens to backfire on everyone. Paolo Genovese and Luca Miniero direct this delightful romantic comedy that co-stars Lorenza Indovina.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: Deliriously happy soon-to-be newlyweds Rich and Julia (Eddie Kaye Thomas and Autumn Reeser) are like any other engaged couple, eagerly awaiting the big day. That could all change, however, if Julia discovers Rich's hair-raising secret: When the moon is full, he morphs into a werewolf. Eric Mabius ("Ugly Betty") co-stars in this wacky blend of comedy, romance and horror.
link.title: synopsis
Sex and the City: The Movie
Black Woman's Guide to Getting Married

link.synopsis: After punching the clock for years in their family's carpet-laying business, brothers Carmine (Dan Fogler) and Anthony (Brendan Sexton III) hire on as videographers with Lou Burns (Jon Polito), the tacky, self-proclaimed king of Long Island wedding video directors. Now, the brothers must deal with living on their own, their boss's wild mood swings and other vagaries of real life. Michael Canzoniero and Marco Ricci direct this comedy.
link.title: synopsis
The Private Lives of Pippa Lee
Assassination of a High School President
The Boys and Girl from County Clare

link.synopsis: A heavy metal star (Stephen Thomas) is electrocuted by his guitar. A timid executive (Scott Graham) accidentally loses his head. And a domineering mother-in-law (Michelle Trout) devours a dish of poisoned pudding. All three mysteriously come back to life, hoping to resume their lives. This zombie comedy shows what happens when the dead try to mingle with the living and discover that it's hard to get on with life when they're actually dead.
link.title: synopsis
The Worst Horror Movie Ever Made
Poultrygeist: Night of the Chicken Dead
Death Valley: The Revenge of Bloody Bill

link.synopsis: When the son of a self-proclaimed New Age prophet falls head over heels for the daughter of his father's archrival, a hard-nosed newspaper publisher, the stage is set for an epic tale of familial discord and star-crossed lovers. But director Sooni Taraporevala puts a lighthearted spin on the classic "Romeo and Juliet" tale, crafting a lively and charming comedy set in the heart of Mumbai's Parsi community.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: For York Hayes (Shawn Carter), scout camp is serious business: It's where bonds are forged, mettle is tested and teamwork wins the day -- and it's here that he wants to leave his legacy. Too bad his troop seems hell-bent on undermining his mission. When Camp Rakhouta's sacred Spirit Stick disappears after one of York's charges uses it during a fight, an untested group of boys must work together to find and return the totem in this family comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Wizards of Waverly Place: The Movie
Cats & Dogs: The Revenge of Kitty Galore
Phineas and Ferb: Across the Second Dimension
Treasure Island Kids 3: The Mystery of Treasure Island
Treasure Island Kids: The Pirates of Treasure Island
Wallace & Gromit: The Curse of the Were-Rabbit
Lemony Snicket's A Series of Unfortunate Events

link.synopsis: Comic titan Richard Pryor shines in this eclectic double feature, playing a family man facing a daunting upheaval in the 1988 comedy Moving and a pioneering stock-car racer in the 1977 biopic Greased Lightning. First, Pryor dives headfirst into slapstick when he tries to relocate his wife and kids from New Jersey to Idaho. Then, the legendary comedian plays it straight, starring in the true story of Wendell Scott, NASCAR's first black driver.
link.title: synopsis
The Bingo Long Traveling All-Stars and Motor Kings
The Last Ride of the Dalton Gang
Jo Jo Dancer, Your Life is Calling
Richard Pryor: Live on the Sunset Strip
See No Evil, Hear No Evil
Balls Out: Gary the Tennis Coach

link.synopsis: Out of respect for his deceased wife, Pastor Jones (Jean-Claude La Marre) steers clear of any romantic entanglements. But when he meets Monique (KiKi Haynes), the little sister of his church's choir director, the pastor starts to question his choice to remain single. And making matters more tempting, Monique is suffering from a bad breakup and can seem to find comfort only with the pastor in this sweet, Christian-themed romantic comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Pastor Jones 2: Help Save My Daughter
Don't Touch If You Ain't Prayed 2
Don't Touch If You Ain't Prayed
Black Woman's Guide to Finding a Good Man
There's a Stranger in My House
Belle and the Beast: A Christian Romance
The Work and the Glory III: A House Divided

title.regular: Pastor Jones: My Sister Loves You
title.short: Pastor Jones: My Sister Loves You

link.synopsis: John Heffron -- a veteran funnyman who shot to fame when he won the second season of NBC's "Last Comic Standing" -- trains his comedic eagle eye on the everyday humor of middle-class life in this sidesplitting set. Raised in a small town in Michigan, the perceptive Heffron finds the laughs in such universal experiences as childhood and marriage. Heffron has appeared on "The Tonight Show," as well as numerous series on VH1 and Comedy Central.
link.title: synopsis
Alonzo Bodden: Tall, Dark and Funny
Jim Jefferies: I Swear to God
Mike Birbiglia: What I Should Have Said Was Nothing: Tales From My Secret Public Journal
Greg Behrendt: Is That Guy from That Thing
Denis Leary and Friends Present: Douchebags & Donuts
Craig Ferguson: A Wee Bit o' Revolution
Ricky Gervais: Out of England: The Stand-Up Special
The Lovemaster... Unzipped with Craig Shoemaker
Jim Breuer: Let's Clear the Air
Ron White: They Call Me "Tater Salad"
Just for Laughs: Stand-Up: Over the Edge
Patton Oswalt: My Weakness Is Strong
Anjelah Johnson: That's How We Do It
Charlie Murphy: I Will Not Apologize
Karen Williams: I Need a Snack
Leslie Jordan: My Trip Down the Pink Carpet: Live in Atlanta
Jeff Dunham's Very Special Christmas Special
Aisha Tyler Is Lit: Live at the Fillmore
Ron White: You Can't Fix Stupid
Dane Cook: Rough Around the Edges: Live from Madison Square Garden

link.synopsis: Known for cashing in on outrageous bets, Sgt. Robert Gray (James Ellison) accepts a wager that he can get hardnosed Gen. Markley (Paul Harvey) to invite him to breakfast. But before he can weasel his way to Markley's table, Gray falls head over heels for the general's daughter (Terry Walker). Morgan Hill, Arthur Lake and Ward Bond also star in this lighthearted musical comedy from Grand National Pictures.
link.title: synopsis
Sorrowful Jones / The Paleface: Double Feature
Thank You, Jeeves / Step Lively, Jeeves!
The Best of Abbott and Costello: Vol. 3
Val Lewton: I Walked with a Zombie / The Body Snatcher
Tarzan, the Ape Man / Tarzan Escapes Double Feature
Take Me Out to the Ball Game
Deanna Durbin: Three Smart Girls / Something in the Wind
Birth of the Blues / Blue Skies: Double Feature
Laurel & Hardy: March of the Wooden Soldiers

link.synopsis: Newlyweds Vijay and Naina fight constantly. And when Vijay's former flame, Pooja (Kranti Redkar), moves in next door, he falls for her all over again, angering Naina. But Naina soon runs into Pooja's husband, her ex-love Vitthal (Bharat Jadhav), and the two rediscover old feelings. Now, as both couples face disintegrating marriages, the question is, who will end up with whom? Kedar Shinde directs this Marathi-language comedy.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: When British-raised Punjabis Roop (Jimmy Shergill) and DJ (Gurpreet Guggi) visit Punjab for the first time, they find themselves at a loss when it comes to socializing. Needless to say, this makes things difficult when they both fall for local girls. If they're going to win over the women they fancy, they'll have to quickly learn a new way of behaving in this romantic comedy from India.
link.title: synopsis
Hum Aapke Dil Mein Rehte Hain

link.synopsis: Shirley and Martin Hirsch (Lainie Kazan and Saul Rubinek) are thrilled to discover that their nice Jewish son Nelson (John Lloyd Young) has a mysterious significant other -- until they find out that the secret lover is his live-in boyfriend, Angelo (Jai Rodriguez). Dismayed by the revelation, the parents bounce between confusion, blame and shame, until Nelson and Angelo announce they intend to adopt a baby. Evgeny Afineevsky directs this comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Karen Williams: I Need a Snack
Leslie Jordan: My Trip Down the Pink Carpet: Live in Atlanta
Otto; or, Up With Dead People
Vickie Shaw: You Can Take the Girl Outta Texas...
Outlaugh: The Best of Queer Comedy
I Now Pronounce You Chuck and Larry

title.regular: Oy Vey! My Son Is Gay!!
title.short: Oy Vey! My Son Is Gay!!

link.synopsis: Hoping to promote a new family harmony, Stan Talmadge (Gary Cole) convinces his alienated daughter and his acerbic ex-wife, Helen (Jennifer Coolidge), to pile in an RV and travel across the country with him to appear on a television game show. But Stan's plan backfires as the trip -- and his hopes -- quickly unravel out on the open road. This comedy from director David Moreton co-stars Tina Holmes, Jordan Bridges and Riki Lindhome.
link.title: synopsis
The Brady Bunch in the White House
Dane Cook: Rough Around the Edges: Live from Madison Square Garden
Big Mommas: Like Father, Like Son
Comics on Duty: We Love You, Mrs. Bevins
Ron White: They Call Me "Tater Salad"
Platinum Comedy Series: The Torry Brothers: A Family Affair
Platinum Comedy Series: Earthquake: About Got Damm Time!
Platinum Comedy Series: Paul Rodriguez: Live in San Quentin
The Boys and Girl from County Clare
Glow Ropes: The Rise and Fall of a Bar Mitzvah Emcee

link.synopsis: When robustly pregnant Carol (Caroleen Feeney) inadvertently hacks off her husband Glenn's (Liev Schreiber) finger while chopping carrots, she uses the missing digit to extort the truth from Glenn about the affairs he's had while she's been pregnant. As their best friends get roped into the absurd situation, the whole surprising truth begins to emerge. This dark comedy from director Hal Salwen also stars Michael Rispoli and Cynthia Watros.
link.title: synopsis
Not Just the Best of the Larry Sanders Show
The Outer Limits: The New Series: Sex and Science Fiction
Kansas: There's Know Place Like Home
Who's Been Sleeping in My Bed?
Diary of a Mad Black Woman: The Play
How to Kill Your Neighbor's Dog
You Will Meet a Tall Dark Stranger

link.synopsis: Paul Kinney directs and stars in this romantic comedy about an anal-retentive author of children's books who's engaged to his editor (Elisabeth Nunziato) but falls in love with another woman (Rachel Songer) while hiding her from her estranged boyfriend. Not surprisingly, forbidden love -- especially when it's directed at an unemployed single mom -- brings unwelcome chaos to author Jack Payne's (Kinney) carefully ordered life.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: When playboy and hotshot Hollywood stuntman Viraj Shergill (Akshay Kumar) tries to stop his brother's impending wedding, his efforts clash with those of brash Simrita Rai (Kareena Kapoor), a friend of the bride who has her own plans to halt the nuptials. But as Viraj and Simrita reluctantly join forces, their friction may spark true love. Sabir Khan directs this Bollywood romantic comedy with cameos by Sylvester Stallone and Denise Richards.
link.title: synopsis
Kal Ho Naa Ho: Tomorrow May Never Come

link.synopsis: When washed-up television action star Ronnie Reno (Chris Klein) finds himself stranded in rural Nevada at the mercy of a murderous meth dealer (Jake Busey) and his gang, he calls on his former TV co-stars to help combat the crooks. But the reunited cast soon realizes they're out of their depth taking on these real-life criminals. Jason Wiles directs this black comedy that co-stars Limp Bizkit front man Fred Durst as the gang's deranged enforcer.
link.title: synopsis
Assassination of a High School President
The Hitcher II: I've Been Waiting
A Film with Me in It

link.synopsis: When happy-go-lucky rumba dancer Fiona and her dance-partner husband, Dom (co-directors Fiona Gordon and Dominique Abel), suffer a severe car crash, they choose not to let Fiona's amputated leg or Dom's blacked-out memory hinder their dance-floor ambitions. But the irrepressible pair can't seem to catch a break, as random fires and other mishaps also threaten to end their dancing career. This pratfall-filled comedy co-stars Bruno Romy.
link.title: synopsis
Rumba Lessons: Dance Like a Star
How Much Do You Love Me?
The Romance of Astrea and Celadon
My Wife Is a Gambling Maestro
I Don't Want to Sleep Alone

link.synopsis: Amidst the twists and turns of an investigation of a drug ring and murder, the lives of five strangers collide with unexpected consequences in this black comedy starring Xun Zhou as a cabby who's been searching for her missing boyfriend for years. A car crash, a dead body and many strange encounters later -- including a run-in with crooks who take her hostage -- she seems to be on track to find her missing man and perhaps a whole lot more.
link.title: synopsis
A Woman, a Gun and a Noodle Shop
Kung Fu Mahjong 3: The Final Duel
If You Are the One: Love and Marriage
The Butcher, the Chef and the Swordsman
Balzac and the Little Chinese Seamstress
Love Is a Many Stupid Thing

title.regular: The Equation of Love and Death
title.short: The Equation of Love and Death

link.synopsis: When he must make good on a promise to introduce a notorious hit man to a Japanese don (Toshiyuki Nishida), nightclub manager Noboru Bingo (Satoshi Tsumabuki) instead hires struggling actor Taiki Murata (Koichi Sato) to portray the legendary killer in a bogus gangster film. Murata, believing he's caught his big break, plays the part with gusto -- blissfully unaware that the bullets are real in this laugh-out-loud comedy helmed by Kôki Mitani.
link.title: synopsis
When the Last Sword Is Drawn
Zatoichi: Vol. 3: New Tale of Zatoichi
Lone Wolf and Cub: Baby Cart to Hades
Death Note: L: Change the WorLd
Legend of the Fist: The Return of Chen Zhen
The Pinky Violence Collection: Criminal Woman: Killing Melody

link.synopsis: Vegetarian cowboy Quick Gun Murugun (Rajendraprasad) will go to heaven and back -- literally -- to save India's sacred cows in this wacky comedy that finds the cowpoke taking on the evil McDosa corporation, which plans to serve beef dosas to the masses. With Rice Plate Reddy (Nasser) leading the beef charge, the six-armed Murugun rises from the dead and travels through time -- singing plenty of songs along the way -- to protect his bovine friends.
link.title: synopsis
Uncle Boonmee Who Can Recall His Past Lives
Shaolin vs. Evil Dead: Ultimate Power
Don't Let Me Die on a Sunday
The Torture Chamber of Dr. Sadism / Death Smiles on a Murderer
Buffy the Vampire Slayer: The Movie

link.synopsis: Everybody comes to Frisky's Bar looking for love -- or at least a warm body -- but since patrons rely on smooth moves, cagey schemes and outright lies, it can be tough to know if real romance ever stands a chance. But as the bartender spouts his impenetrable philosophies and frat boys encounter cougars on the prowl, one couple discovers the spark of something that may be the real deal. Screenwriter Bill Briles directs this offbeat indie comedy.
link.title: synopsis
The Fresh Prince of Bel Air
François Ozon: A Curtain Raiser & Other Shorts
The Worst Week of My Life
Luke and Brie Are on a First Date
How to Go Out on a Date in Queens

link.synopsis: Award-winning stand-up comic Mitch Fatel takes the stage in this Comedy Central special that showcases the funnyman's trademark sexually charged humor, delivered with an oh-so-innocent "Who, me?" grin. The devilishly understated Fatel thrills his live audience with deadpan zingers on topics that could make even a sailor blush. No subject is too taboo for the man who once interned on Howard Stern's radio show.
link.title: synopsis
Just for Laughs: Stand-Up: Vol. 2: On the Edge
Joe Rogan: Talking Monkeys in Space
Jim Breuer: Let's Clear the Air
Russell Brand in New York City
Stephen Lynch: Live at the El Rey
Patton Oswalt: My Weakness Is Strong
Jamie Foxx Presents: America's Funniest Comics: Vol. 4
Gabriel Iglesias: I'm Not Fat ... I'm Fluffy
National Lampoon Presents: One, Two, Many
Jamie Foxx Unleashed: Lost, Stolen and Leaked!
The 41-Year-Old Virgin Who Knocked Up Sarah Marshall and Felt Superbad About It

link.synopsis: Peking Opera janitor Old Han (Zongluo Huang) doesn't know what to do with himself when his longtime employer decides it's time for him to retire ... until he meets some senior-citizen opera buffs who convince him to lead their fledgling opera club. After renting a space to stage their productions, the oldsters are dismayed when Old Han reveals himself to be a stern and unyielding taskmaster in this comedy from director Ying Ning.
link.title: synopsis
Truth or Dare: 6th Floor Rear Flat

link.synopsis: After a disappointing night of lovemaking, young record executive Andy Conners (Josh Meyers) ignores the bigger problems of his relationship with Lauren (Krysten Ritter) and instead concentrates solely on improving his sexual technique. But while Andy undergoes his misguided makeover, Lauren rekindles a romance with an old flame. Will Andy learn his lesson in time to win back Lauren? Jenna Jameson also stars as herself in this edgy romantic comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Evil Breed: The Legend of Samhain
Naked Ambition: An R-Rated Look at an X-Rated Industry

title.regular: How to Make Love to a Woman
title.short: How to Make Love to a Woman

link.synopsis: While visiting a small town to serve on a film festival jury, director Ku Kyung-nam (Tae-woo Kim) has an eventful booze-filled night with an old pal and his wife. Twelve days later, Ku has a similarly crazy time with another old friend and his wife. Ace South Korean auteur Sang-soo Hong finds comedy and drama in this loose but elegant portrait of an artist -- an official selection at the Toronto International Film Festival.
link.title: synopsis
Woman Is the Future of Man
The Virgin Stripped Bare by Her Bachelors
I Really, Really Like You: Vol. 2
Save the Last Dance for Me
Tae Guk Gi: The Brotherhood of War

link.synopsis: Despite being dumped by his girlfriend and enduring a string of blind dates, Taylor (Christopher Boyd) still believes that his true love is out there somewhere. Then he meets Swain (Mircea Monroe), who has the cynical attitude toward romance Taylor should have developed long ago. Their first date flops, but fate's not about to give up on these two, who truly deserve a shot at real love. Christopher Bello co-stars in this knowing romantic comedy.
link.title: synopsis
The 41-Year-Old Virgin Who Knocked Up Sarah Marshall and Felt Superbad About It
Luke and Brie Are on a First Date
The Mostly Unfabulous Social Life of Ethan Green
I Do: How to Get Married and Stay Single
The Boys and Girl from County Clare
Donald and Dot Clock Found Dead in Their Home

link.synopsis: In a role that's a far cry from the hard-boiled characters she later became associated with, Ida Lupino plays an innocent beauty whom an actor (Francis Lederer) mistakes for his mistress in a darkened theater in this 1936 romantic comedy. When the thespian is caught kissing the fresh-faced stranger, he's prosecuted as a masher -- a charge he can't protest without revealing the identity of his mistress. A zany trial ensues.
link.title: synopsis
The Incredible Shrinking Man / The Monolith Monsters
The Bridge of San Luis Rey
Here Comes Cookie / Love in Bloom / Six of a Kind: Triple Feature
You Can't Take It with You
That Wonderful Urge / Love Is News
I Met Him in Paris / Bluebeard's Eighth Wife
Son of Frankenstein / Ghost of Frankenstein

link.synopsis: Showcasing her pioneering creativity as an early filmmaker, this compilation of more than 60 short films by director Alice Guy features works she created for the Gaumont Film Company before moving to the United States. Selections cover genres ranging from comedy to social commentary and religion -- including "The Birth, the Life and the Death of Christ" -- and encompass early experimental techniques such as hand-coloring and synchronized sound.
link.title: synopsis
Gaumont Treasures: The Films of Louis Feuillade
Edison: The Invention of the Movies
Gaumont Treasures: The Films of Leonce Perret
The Cheat / Merrily We Go to Hell
Reel Baseball: Baseball Films of the Silent Era
The Wonderful, Horrible Life of Leni Riefenstahl
Treasures from American Film Archives: Vol. 3
Avant-Garde: Experimental Cinema of the 1920s and '30s: Vol. 1
Brigitte and Brigitte / Up and Down: The Films of Luc Moullet
I Do: How to Get Married and Stay Single
Lent in the Month of March

title.regular: Gaumont Treasures: The Films of Alice Guy
title.short: Gaumont Treasures: The Films of Alice Guy

link.synopsis: Though his name has been most associated with espionage serials "Les Vampires" and "Fantomas," director Louis Feuillade made a profound contribution to early French cinema, as seen in this collection of his films from the Gaumont Film Company. Culled from the nearly 800 films he directed, the features range from lighter fare, such as comedy and fantasy, to more serious tragedy, social commentary and historical epics.
link.title: synopsis
Gaumont Treasures: The Films of Leonce Perret
Gaumont Treasures: The Films of Alice Guy
Mad Love: The Films of Evgeni Bauer
Johnny Legend Presents: The Complete Weird Cartoons
Man with a Camera: Complete Collection
Homicide: Life on the Street: Season 6
Homicide: Life on the Street: Season 4
7 Dollars on Red / Apocalypse Joe / Bounty Killer / Minnesota Clay
Turkish Pop Cinema Double Bill: The Deathless Devil / Tarkan vs. the Vikings
Three Films by Alexander Sokurov: Oriental Elegy / Dolce / A Humble Life
Sin Syndicate / Sin Magazine / She Came on the Bus: Triple Feature
Brigitte and Brigitte / Up and Down: The Films of Luc Moullet
I Do: How to Get Married and Stay Single
Lent in the Month of March

title.regular: Gaumont Treasures: The Films of Louis Feuillade

link.synopsis: Mexican auteur Arturo Ripstein uses an upcoming carnival as the framing device to illuminate the delicate balance of life in a bordello for an odd assortment of society's outcasts in this dark comedy starring Patricia Reyes Spndola. As the brothel's regulars and residents -- including artists, poets, soldiers, prostitutes and more -- select their garb for the upcoming celebration, a stranger enters their midst and chaos ensues.
link.title: synopsis
A Good Death Beats a Dull Life
El Coronel No Tiene Quien Le Escriba

link.synopsis: It's merit badge mania when not-too-bright but very enthusiastic Tiger Scout Brandon Appleorchard (played by former SNL funnyman Chris Kattan) joins a highly competitive contest to win the position of head honcho at a scouting camp. Veteran comedian Fred Willard co-stars as the camp's Game Master alongside Kattan's real-life father, Kip King, in this kooky comedy about one man's quest to be the best.
link.title: synopsis
The Last Lovecraft: Relic of Cthulhu

title.regular: Scout's Honor: Badge to the Bone
title.short: Scout's Honor: Badge to the Bone

link.synopsis: While hacking an occult Web site for a Goth girl (Casidee Riley), student council hopeful Dave (Zak Kreiter) accidentally unleashes a nasty demon that takes over his body. As Dave runs wild as the spawn of Satan, his friends attempt a series of wacky schemes to save him. Directed by Todd Livingston, this outrageous college comedy features a botched exorcism, projectile vomit and plenty of creepy characters.
link.title: synopsis
Hell House: The Book of Samiel
Children of the Corn 5: Fields of Terror
Children of the Corn IV: The Gathering
Coons! Night of the Bandits of the Night

link.synopsis: Dillydale -- hometown to a bevy of Mr. Men and Little Misses -- serves as the setting for this animated kids' variety show based on Roger Hargreaves' popular children's books from the 1970s, '80s and '90s. The always-perky Little Miss Sunshine -- co-host of "Good Morning Dillydale" -- joins a raft of other Mr. Men and Little Misses (many of whom aren't nearly as sunny) in comedy sketches, dance numbers and more in the episodes collected here.
link.title: synopsis
The Mr. Men Show: Mr. Tickle Presents: Tickle Time Around Town!
Sesame Street: Bert and Ernie's Great Adventures
Martha Speaks: Martha Says It with Flowers
Dr. Seuss: Green Eggs and Ham and Other Favorites
Playmobil: The Secret of Pirate Island
Alvin and the Chipmunks: The Chipettes!
Sesame Street: Firefly Fun and Buggy Buddy
Mickey Mouse Clubhouse: Mickey's Storybook Surprises
Adventures of the Gummi Bears: Vol. 1: Seasons 1-3
Hurray for Huckle: Zooming Around Busytown
Hurray for Huckle: The Very Best Busytown Friends Ever
Beatrix Potter: The Tale of Pigling Bland and Other Stories
Beatrix Potter: The World of Peter Rabbit and Friends
Diary of a Spider and More Cute Critter Stories
Once Upon a Time: A Storybook Collection
Disney's Little Einsteins: Fire Truck Rocket's Blastoff
The Backyardigans: Join the Adventurer's Club
The Backyardigans: Escape from the Tower
The Backyardigans: Escape from Fairytale Village
The Land Before Time: Adventuring in the Mysterious Beyond
The Backyardigans: Robin Hood the Clean
The Land Before Time: Friends Forever
The Backyardigans: Tale of the Mighty Knights
Disney's Little Einsteins: Flight of the Instrument Fairies
Blue's Clues: Blue's Room: Little Blue Riding Hood

title.regular: The Mr. Men Show: Little Miss Sunshine Presents: Fun in the Sun!
title.short: Little Miss Sunshine: Fun in the Sun!

link.synopsis: It's a comedy of errors when Anupama (Meena), a single girl who's desperate to stay far, far away from marriage, concocts a wild story about already having a "lover." (But the truth is, he's just a guy whose face she saw once in a photo.) Now that her relatives have a face to go on, they're determined to find Anupama's man. But their misguided search leads them to three different suspects (all played by Jayaram)!
link.title: synopsis
The Bible Collection: Samson and Delilah

link.synopsis: When Blad Babji (Allari Naresh) -- a pickpocket with a Robin Hood complex -- robs a bank, he hopes to nab enough dough to save area slum dwellers from a builder. But good intentions may not amount to much if he can't get his hands on the money. And that could be difficult when the under-construction building that hides the loot becomes a police station during the time Babji and his cohorts are keeping a low profile in this comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Sree Seetha Ramula Kalyanam Chutamu Raarandi

link.synopsis: Never lie to your mother: a big lesson New York resident Chintakayala Ravi (Venkatesh) learns when he tells his mother back in India that he's working as a software engineer -- when he's really laboring in a bar. Trouble ensues when Ravi's well-meaning mom (Lakshmi Narayan) sets up her son with a nice girl (Mamtha Mohandas) from back home, and the girl asks her New York buddy (Anushka Shetty) to check Ravi out in this comedy helmed by Yogie.
link.title: synopsis
Sree Seetha Ramula Kalyanam Chutamu Raarandi

link.synopsis: In this slapstick comedy directed by Rajasenan, the film's hero, Manu, changes names and faiths like other people change their clothes, claiming no less than three monikers and two religions in his pursuit of love and money. Going from Manu to Manuel (when he converts to Christianity) to Subramani (when he's posing as a Brahmin), the harried hero eventually finds himself at a resort pursued by three women -- all of whom think they're marrying him.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: Relive some of the biggest song-and-dance routines and the most emotional songs from acclaimed Bollywood producer and director Karan Johar. This collection features dozens of songs from three of his most popular films. The collection features selections from the romantic comedy Kuch Kuch Hota Hai, the box office smash drama Kabhi Khushi Kabhie Gham, and Kal Ho Naa Ho, his masterpiece about love and self-sacrifice.
link.title: synopsis
The Very Best of Pandit Jasraj: Vol. 2
The Very Best of Pandit Jasraj: Vol. 1
Ru Ba Ru: Amjad Ali Khan / Bismillah Khan
Golden Collection: Mohammed Rafi: Rare Gems: Vol. 2
Duets of Asha with Rafi & Kishore
The Gurus of Bandish: Ustad Rashid Khan: Live
Pandit Hariprasad Chaurasia: Live in Concert
Nostalgic Moments: Duets of Mohd Rafi
Kal Aaj Aur Hamesha... Asha Solo
Live: The Greatest Hits of Side A
Sikkil Gurucharan: Live Recording Music Season 2007
Barbie Rocks the Big Dome Live
Savai Gandharva Music Festival, Pune 2007: Pandit Jasraj
Savai Gandharva Music Festival, Pune 2007: Pandit Bhimsen Joshi: Vol. 2
Parokya Ni Edgar Matira Matibay: Greatest Hits Concert

link.synopsis: Comedy Central veterans Michael Ian Black, Michael Showalter and David Wain, who comprise the hilarious comic troupe Stella, take to the stage at the Wilbur Theatre in Boston with their unique brand of humor. Heavy in pure wit and improvisation, Stella debuts their "Birthday" bit and trots out such classics as "Megan Ford" and "America." Bonus features include footage from the group's 2003 shows in New York City nightclub Fez.
link.title: synopsis
Comedy Central Salutes George W. Bush
The League of Gentlemen: Christmas Special
Mystery Science Theater 3000: Horrors of Spider Island
Eating Out: All You Can Eat
Futurama: Into the Wild Green Yonder
The Vicar of Dibley: 10th Anniversary Specials
Jamie Foxx Unleashed: Lost, Stolen and Leaked!

link.synopsis: In this classic 1960s sitcom, Patty and Cathy are cousins -- identical cousins -- both portrayed by Emmy nominee Patty Duke as a pair of fun-loving, occasionally mischief-making teens running mildly wild in Brooklyn Heights, N.Y. The crowd-pleasing comedy hit ran for three successful seasons on ABC. Season 1 includes the show's first 26 episodes and promises hours of cheeky, nostalgic entertainment.
link.title: synopsis
The Patty Duke Show: Season 1: Disc 1
The Patty Duke Show: Season 1: Disc 2
The Patty Duke Show: Season 1: Disc 3
The Patty Duke Show: Season 1: Disc 4
The Patty Duke Show: Season 1: Disc 5
The Patty Duke Show: Season 1: Disc 6
Patty Duke Show: Still Rockin' in Brooklyn Heights
Doctor Who: Lost in Time: The William Hartnell Years
Doctor Who: The Dalek Invasion of Earth
The Loretta Young Show: Christina's Children Series
Doctor Who: The Keys of Marinus

link.synopsis: In this follow-up to the inspirational musical comedy Reverend I'm Available, former scoundrel Alex Johnson hears the call of the Lord, gives up his sinful ways, becomes a full-time minister of the faith and finds more trouble than he bargained for. Suddenly, Alex has his hands full with more women than he knows what to do with. Who knew that men of the cloth were considered the most eligible bachelors in the community?
link.title: synopsis
Pastor Jones: My Sister Loves You
Blindman / Massacre Time / One Dollar Too Many / The Beast
Once Upon a Time in China: The Next Chapters
Tyler Perry's Madea Goes to Jail
Black Woman's Guide to Getting Married
Diary of a Mad Black Woman: The Play
Black Woman's Guide to Finding a Good Man
Why We Laugh: Black Comedians on Black Comedy
Comedy Express: B.T.: I'm Not Black Enough
Shaquille O'Neal Presents: All Star Comedy Jam: Live from South Beach

link.synopsis: Vicky Chopra's episodic holiday-themed comedy introduces six plot lines that ultimately intersect over the course of a wild New Year's Eve celebration. Real-life sisters Raima and Riya Sen play siblings in one of the stories. Among the other names in the ensemble cast are Tabu, Shilpa Shukla, Javed Jaffrey and off-screen pals Vatsal Seth and Sohail Khan, who play brothers.
link.title: synopsis
Rocket Singh: Salesman of the Year

link.synopsis: Longing for love, scientist Ou Fanfan (Zhou Xun) invents pheromone stickers to attract men -- and when she crosses paths with a gorgeous but cynical businesswoman (Kitty Zhang Yugi) and a tomboyish rocker (Lunmei Kwai), her invention leads to a chaotic swirl of chance encounters and romance. Eddie Peng, Stephen Fung and Alex Fong co-star as the three women's love interests in this quirky comedy from Hong Kong director Hark Tsui.
link.title: synopsis
War File: Battlefield: The Battle for Normandy
Detective Dee and the Mystery of the Phantom Flame
My Wife Is a Gambling Maestro
A Woman, a Gun and a Noodle Shop
If You Are the One: Love and Marriage
The Butcher, the Chef and the Swordsman
Truth or Dare: 6th Floor Rear Flat

link.synopsis: Everybody has to grow up sometime, and for 30-year-old Mia (Lindsay Michelle Nader), that time has finally come -- though it will take a wayward cat, a would-be rock star and a wild romp through New York's East Village to set her on her way in this charming indie comedy. Charged with caring for her sister's flighty feline, Mia comes face-to-face with failure -- and her own surprising resolve to succeed -- when her precious cargo escapes.
link.title: synopsis
Luke and Brie Are on a First Date
Tyler Perry's Madea Goes to Jail
Glow Ropes: The Rise and Fall of a Bar Mitzvah Emcee
Dave Barry's Complete Guide to Guys
Donald and Dot Clock Found Dead in Their Home

link.synopsis: After experiencing a near-fatal accident, gay teen Isao wakes up in limbo, a strange setting where the past and future don't exist. Beside a suicidal lawyer and bizarre nurse, Isao begins a journey of self-discovery that will transform his life. Written and directed by Horacio Rivera, this imaginative Mexican comedy stars Francisco Barcala, Rubn Cristiany, Ftima Daz, Enoc Leao and Erika de la Llave.
link.title: synopsis
The Boy with the Sun in His Eyes

link.synopsis: Confronted by his boss about his lackluster job performance, mild-mannered stockbroker Charlie (Craig Lauzon) agrees to earn his keep by doing some ill-defined work for the powerful and mysterious Roland Gow (Maury Chaykin). Before long, Charlie descends into a twisted world of intrigue, duplicity and murder from which he might never escape. Kent Tessman directs this dark comedy that co-stars Simon Reynolds.
link.title: synopsis
Assassination of a High School President
How to Lose Friends & Alienate People
The Great Bank Hoax / The Great Bank Robbery
Thank You, Jeeves / Step Lively, Jeeves!
Wild Things: Diamonds in the Rough
Hopalong Cassidy: Riders of the Timberline / Riders of the Deadline / False Paradise / Unexpected Guest / Wide Open Town

link.synopsis: A man wakes up in an empty, doorless room in this absurdist comedy directed by and starring Japanese superstar comedian Hitoshi Matsumoto. Pressing a phallic protrusion on the wall, he sets off a series of strange events as he tries to escape. Meanwhile, a masked Mexican wrestler's family worries about his passive preparations for an important match. He steps into the ring as the trapped man deals with the odd objects appearing in his room.
link.title: synopsis
The Last Days of the World
When the Last Sword Is Drawn
Requiem for a Bodyguard: Vol. 4: Gun Crazy

link.synopsis: Comedy, horror and wrestling combine in this fight fest starring real-life wrestler Shinya Hashimoto as Kouta, a grappler who finds his mansion in shambles and his wife transformed into a zombie mermaid following a housewarming party gone awry. Needing cash to fix his home -- and his beloved -- Kouta holds a multistage death match on live television, taking on everyone from a kung fu expert to a chandelier-wielding maniac.
link.title: synopsis
Nu-Meri: Book of the New Spawn
Full Bottom: Not Another Half-Arsed Release
Bushido: The Cruel Code of the Samurai
New Manager of the Sumo Club
The Most Terrible Time in My Life
The Legend of Dinosaurs and Monster Birds
The Haunted World of El Superbeasto

link.synopsis: A lot can change in 30 years. Just ask thieves Tito (Federico Luppi) and Castor (Ulises Dumont), who after three decades behind bars are finding that life on the outside is not exactly as they expected -- starting with the missing loot they stashed before their lockup. With their money gone and with it their trust in their old gang, the ex-partners in crime start scheming anew in this acclaimed comedy from Argentinean director Rodrigo Grande.
link.title: synopsis
Jerry Lee Lewis: Last Man Standing Live

link.synopsis: In this surreal black comedy from Argentinean writer and director Sergio Bizzio, a fluffy white lamb becomes the object of affection -- and obsession -- for a wealthy businessman bored with his socialite wife. Falling deeply, madly in lust with Fanny (the lamb), Alberto (Carlos Roffe) will go to any length to keep friends and family from standing in his way. And when a black ram competes for Fanny's affections, he'll deal with him as well.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: America's favorite hillbilly, Jon Reep of Dodge Ram commercial fame, brings his Metro Jethro sensibility into America's living rooms with this comedy special featuring his trademark raised-in-the-boondocks-but-living-the-city-now humor. Poking fun at his "well-read neck" brethren -- the folks like himself who love to deep-fry their sushi and put moonshine in their martinis -- Reep delivers nonstop laughs in this stand-up showcase.
link.title: synopsis
Just for Laughs: Stand-Up: Working Class Comics
Blue Collar Comedy Tour: The Next Generation
John Pinette: I Say Nay Nay
Frank Caliendo: All Over the Place
Jim Breuer: Let's Clear the Air
Patton Oswalt: No Reason to Complain: Uncensored
Artie Lange: It's the Whiskey Talkin'
Stephen Lynch: Live at the El Rey
Ron White: They Call Me "Tater Salad"
Just for Laughs: Stand-Up: Over the Edge

Jeff Dunham's Very Special Christmas Special
Aisha Tyler Is Lit: Live at the Fillmore
Blue Collar Comedy Tour: The Movie
Ron White: You Can't Fix Stupid

link.synopsis: When he learns that his sperm may be defective, small-time rock vocalist Alex (Hamilton von Watts) decides to father a child before it's too late -- if not with his reluctant wife, Jules (Keri Safran), then with his beautiful manager, Claudia (Lisa Sheridan). But when his band gets a shot at the big time, dad-to-be Alex discovers that he's bitten off more than he can chew. This comedy from director Jason S. Dennis also stars Spencer Gibb.
link.title: synopsis
He's Just Not That Into You
You Will Meet a Tall Dark Stranger
Marilyn Hotchkiss Ballroom Dancing and Charm School
Tristram Shandy: A Cock and Bull Story

link.synopsis: Far from the lights of Tinseltown, a group of would-be screenwriters meets every week to commiserate over their collective creative rut -- until new member Sylvia (Shay Gines) brings fresh inspiration to the group's leader, George (Howard Nash). Now George schemes to seduce Sylvia right under the nose of his wife, Faye (Ellen Reilly). Blake Lawrence directs this offbeat comedy that co-stars Wynne Anders and Nathanial Hernandez.
link.title: synopsis
Glow Ropes: The Rise and Fall of a Bar Mitzvah Emcee
Donald and Dot Clock Found Dead in Their Home
Dave Barry's Complete Guide to Guys

link.synopsis: After his wife (Shauna Black) leaves him, comedy scribe Gus Lawton (David Kemker) pursues her all the way back to the old house she grew up in. To win her back, he begins fixing up the place. But what he digs up -- a zombie (David Sparrow) -- brings a whole new set of problems. Faced with a member of the living dead who will do anything he demands, Gus initially thinks he's in heaven. Unfortunately for him, his assumption is quickly proved wrong.
link.title: synopsis
Val Lewton: Isle of the Dead / Bedlam
Otto; or, Up With Dead People

link.synopsis: Stage director Max Stafford-Clark offers this production of Oliver Goldsmith's enduring 18th-century farce, which follows the wild ruses of aristocrats and their guests as they seek love and treasure in a country manor over the course of one night. As heiress Kate (Monica Dolan) poses as a barmaid to win over Charles (Christopher Staines), their friends attempt madcap schemes of their own. Fritha Goodey co-stars in this classic comedy of manners.
link.title: synopsis
The Harold Lloyd Comedy Collection: Vol. 3
The Country Wife / Blue Remembered Hills
The Ellen Show: The Complete Series
Deanna Durbin: Three Smart Girls / Something in the Wind
The Thorn Birds: The Missing Years
Shakespeare Comedies: As You Like It
Broadway Theatre Archive: The First Breeze of Summer
Broadway Theatre Archive: The Rules of the Game
Broadway Theatre Archive: The School for Scandal
A Prairie Home Companion with Garrison Keillor
Jango Edwards: The Best of Jango
Cirque du Soleil: La Magie Continue
Cody! An Evening with Buffalo Bill

link.synopsis: In the mystery You'll Find Out, a musician encounters dodgy characters when he performs at an eerie manor house, and in the comedy Zombies on Broadway, two hapless publicists try to recruit a Caribbean zombie for a New York nightclub appearance. David Butler and Gordon Douglas direct these entertaining vintage films that star Boris Karloff, Bela Lugosi, Peter Lorre, Wally Brown, Alan Carney and Anne Jeffreys.
link.title: synopsis
Val Lewton: Isle of the Dead / Bedlam
Before I Hang / The Boogie Man Will Get You
The Man Who Changed His Mind
Val Lewton: I Walked with a Zombie / The Body Snatcher

Son of Frankenstein / Ghost of Frankenstein
Voodoo Island / The Four Skulls of Jonathan Drake: Double Feature

Die, Monster, Die! / The Dunwich Horror: Double Feature

title.regular: You'll Find Out / Zombies on Broadway
title.short: You'll Find Out / Zombies on Broadway

link.synopsis: Taking pity on the shoplifter and fellow Hoosier (Barbara Stanwyck) he's prosecuting just before Christmas, Manhattan lawyer John Sargent (Fred MacMurray) springs the gal from jail and drives her home to Indiana for the holidays in this classic romantic comedy. Soon, the unlikely pair falls in love, but their affair is overshadowed by the trial awaiting them back in New York. Beulah Bondi and Willard Robertson co-star.
link.title: synopsis
No Time for Love / The Egg and I
I Was a Male War Bride
I Met Him in Paris / Bluebeard's Eighth Wife

link.synopsis: Feeling at loose ends after being jettisoned by his longtime girlfriend, young businessman Peter (Anthony Palermo) starts to fall for beautiful new-girl-in-town Rebecca (Anita Barone) -- who just happens to be engaged to another man. The pair agrees to keep their burgeoning friendship platonic, but they soon wonder how long they can keep their resolve. Maria Burton directs this charming romantic comedy that co-stars Hal Linden and Tim Bohn.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: Boldly defying the wishes of his famous father, opera-singing ex-serviceman Dick (Johnny Johnston) rebuffs his socialite girlfriend, Frances (Mary Stuart), and does everything he can to win the heart of beautiful water ballet star Nora (Esther Williams). Also starring Jimmy Durante, Xavier Cugat and Lauritz Melchior, this charming musical comedy features classic tunes such as "Inka Dinka Do" and "You Are So Easy to Love."
link.title: synopsis
Take Me Out to the Ball Game
Rhythm on the Range / Rhythm on the River: Double Feature

link.synopsis: This anthology showcases highlights from the deliriously weird New York public access television show "Turn of the Century," the brainchild of artist Dame Darcy and filmmaker Lisa Hammer that includes singing, dancing, comedy, drama and more. Airing from 1996-99, the show revels in its offbeat personality as characters from the local underground scene -- and occasionally bona fide celebrities like Courtney Love -- stop by to make an appearance.
link.title: synopsis
Twilight of the Ice Nymphs / Archangel
The Best of So Graham Norton

link.synopsis: Known for blending live performance, irreverent comedy, experimental film and conceptual art, Michael Galbreth and Jack Massing -- collectively known as The Art Guys -- have been entertaining audiences around the world for more than 25 years. Produced by Microcinema International, this program features performance highlights from several "Guys" appearances as well as the documentary Nothing to it: The Art Guys in Concert, filmed in 2008.
